dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1382 IH: Taking Account of Bureaucrats’ Spending Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Barr (for himself, Mrs. Kim of California, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Davidson, Mr. Williams of Texas, Mr. Mooney, Mr. Flood, Mr. Hill, Mr. Emmer, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Steil, Mr. Fitzgerald, Mr. Loudermilk, Mrs. Houchin, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Lawler, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Timmons, and Mr. Posey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To change the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection into an independent agency named the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency, to transition the Agency to the regular appropriations process, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Taking Account of Bureaucrats’ Spending Act of 2023 or the TABS Act of 2023.

subsection.header: Making the Bureau an independent Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency
subsection.text: The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5481 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1011—

subparagraph.text: in the heading of such section, by striking BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in the heading of such subsection, by striking Bureau and inserting Agency;
by striking in the Federal Reserve System,;
by striking independent bureau and inserting independent agency; and
by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Agency);

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(5), by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:
shall be appointed by the President; and
in subsection (c), by striking paragraph (3);
in subsection (e), by striking , including in cities in which the Federal reserve banks, or branches of such banks, are located,; and
by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency; and

paragraph.text: in section 1012—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(10), by striking examinations,; and
by striking subsection (c).

subsection.text: Any reference in a law, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection shall be deemed a reference to the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
paragraph.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the table of contents in section 1(b)—

clause.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in the table of contents relating to title X, in the items relating to subtitle B, subtitle C, and section 1027, by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency;

subparagraph.text: in section 2, by amending paragraph (4) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency established under title X.

subparagraph.text: in section 342 by striking Bureau each place such term appears in headings and text and inserting Agency;
in section 1400(b)—

clause.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in the subsection heading, by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;

subparagraph.text: in section 1411(a)(1), by striking Bureau and inserting Agency; and
in section 1447, by striking Director of the Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Director of the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Alternative Mortgage Transaction Parity Act of 1982
paragraph.text: The Alternative Mortgage Transaction Parity Act of 1982 (12 U.S.C. 3801 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in the subsection heading of subsection (d) of section 804 (12 U.S.C. 3803(d)), by striking Bureau and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Electronic Fund Transfer Act (15 U.S.C. 1693 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending the second paragraph (4) (defining the term Bureau) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: the term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;

subparagraph.text: in section 916(d)(1), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
by striking Bureau each place that term appears in heading or text and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 702 (15 U.S.C. 1691a), by amending subsection (c) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau each place that term appears in heading or text and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Expedited Funds Availability Act (12 U.S.C. 4001 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in the heading of section 605(f)(1), by striking board and bureau and inserting Board and Agency.

paragraph.header: Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act of 2003
paragraph.text: The Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act of 2003 (Public Law 108–159) is amended by striking Bureau each place such term appears in heading and text and inserting Agency.
The Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending section 603(w) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau each place such term appears, other than in sections 626 and 603(v), and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending section 803(1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1811 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the second paragraph (6) (with the heading Referral to bureau of consumer financial protection) of section 8(t) (12 U.S.C. 1818(t))—

clause.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking bureau of consumer financial protection; and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;

subparagraph.text: by amending clause (vi) of section 11(t)(2)(A) (12 U.S.C. 1821(t)(2)(A)(vi)) to read as follows:
in section 18(x) (12 U.S.C. 1828(x)), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency; and
in section 43(e) (12 U.S.C. 1831t(e)), by amending paragraph (5) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
paragraph.text: The Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978 (12 U.S.C. 3301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 1004(a)(4), by striking Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in section 1011, by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989
paragraph.text: The Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 (Public Law 101–73; 103 Stat. 183) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 1112(b) (12 U.S.C. 3341), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
in section 1124 (12 U.S.C. 3353), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
in section 1125 (12 U.S.C. 3354), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and

in section 1206(a) (12 U.S.C. 1833b(a)), by striking Federal Housing Finance Board and all that follows through Farm Credit Administration and inserting Federal Housing Finance Agency, the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency, and the Farm Credit Administration.

paragraph.header: Financial Literacy and Education Improvement Act
paragraph.text: Section 513 of the Financial Literacy and Education Improvement Act (20 U.S.C. 9702) is amended by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.
Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (15 U.S.C. 6801 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in section 505(a)(8) (15 U.S.C. 6805(a)(8)), by striking Bureau and inserting Agency.

paragraph.text: The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 (12 U.S.C. 2801 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency; and
in section 303, by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: the term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
Section 10(a)(4) of the Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 (12 U.S.C. 4909(a)(4)) is amended by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Home Ownership and Equity Protection Act of 1994
paragraph.text: Section 158(a) of the Home Ownership and Equity Protection Act of 1994 (15 U.S.C. 1601 note) is amended by striking Bureau and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Interstate Land Sales Full Disclosure Act
paragraph.text: The Interstate Land Sales Full Disclosure Act (12 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Agency;
in section 1402, by amending paragraph (12) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: in section 1416, by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency.

paragraph.header: Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974
paragraph.text: The Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 (12 U.S.C. 2601 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency; and
in section 3, by amending paragraph (9) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: the term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Revised Statues of the United States
paragraph.text: Section 5136C(b)(3)(B) of the Revised Statutes of the United States (12 U.S.C. 25b(b)(3)(B)) is amended by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.header: Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978
paragraph.text: The Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 (12 U.S.C. 3401 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending subparagraph (B) of section 1101(7) (12 U.S.C. 3401(7)(B)) to read as follows:
the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.text: The S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (12 U.S.C. 5101 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 1507, by striking Bureau, and the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;
by striking Bureau each place such appears, other than in sections 1505(a)(1), 1507(a)(2)(A), and 1511(b), and inserting Agency;
in section 1503, by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: in the heading of section 1508, by striking BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in the heading of section 1514, by striking BUREAU and inserting AGENCY.

paragraph.header: Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act
paragraph.text: The Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act (15 U.S.C. 6101 et seq.) is amended by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.
Title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 552a(w)—

clause.text: in the subsection heading, by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency;

subparagraph.text: in section 609(d)(2), by striking Consumer Financial Protection Bureau of the Federal Reserve System and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency; and
in section 3132(a)(1)(D), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.
Section 987(h)(3)(E) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

Section 557(a) of the Carl Levin and Howard P. Buck McKeon National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015 (Public Law 113–29; 128 Stat. 3381; 10 U.S.C. 1144 note), is amended by striking Consumer Financial Protection Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.text: Title 44, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 3502(5), by striking the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection,; and
in section 3513(c), by striking Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and inserting Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

paragraph.text: The Truth in Lending Act (15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending section 103(b) (15 U.S.C. 1602(b)) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: by amending section 103(c) (15 U.S.C. 1602(c)) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The term Board means the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.

subparagraph.text: in section 128(f) (15 U.S.C. 1638(f)), by striking Board each place such term appears and inserting Agency;
in sections 129B (15 U.S.C. 1639b) and 129C (15 U.S.C. 1639c), by striking Board each place such term appears and inserting Agency;
in section 140A (15 U.S.C. 1651), by striking in consultation with the Bureau and inserting in consultation with the Federal Trade Commission;
by striking Bureau each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Agency; and
by striking bureau and inserting Agency in the paragraph headings for—

paragraph.text: The Truth in Savings Act (12 U.S.C. 4301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (4) of section 274 (12 U.S.C. 4313(4)) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term Agency means the Consumer Financial Empowerment Agency.

subparagraph.text: by striking National Credit Union Administration Bureau each place such term appears and inserting National Credit Union Administration Board; and
by striking Bureau each place such term appears and inserting Agency, except in section 233(b)(4)(B).

section.header: Bringing the Agency into the regular appropriations process
section.text: Section 1017 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5497) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: by amending the heading of such subsection to read as follows: Budget, financial management, and audit.—;
by striking paragraphs (1), (2), and (3);
by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively; and
by striking subparagraphs (E) and (F) of paragraph (1), as so redesignated;

paragraph.text: by striking subsections (b) and (c);
by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (b) and (c), respectively; and
in subsection (c), as so redesignated—

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this title for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025.

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (2).
